alert.note: Alert for Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 6:56PM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... South Anna River near Ashland affecting Hanover County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Anna River near Ashland. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood lowlands downstream of gage in the vicinity of VA routes 686 and 667. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM EST Saturday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to fall tonight, and should fall below flood stage by late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 11/21/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 700 AM EST.
